decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is a control strategy centered around Tasigur, the Golden Fang as the commander. The deck is built to control the game by utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain card advantage through spells like Brainstorm, Ancestral Vision, and Sylvan Library. The deck also includes a suite of removal spells such as Damnation, Maelstrom Pulse, and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats on the board. Additionally, the deck includes several recursion spells like Reanimate and Life from the Loam to recover resources and maintain board control. The manabase is carefully constructed to support the control strategy and provide access to all necessary colors.

This deck revolves around quickly ramping up mana with cards like Wild Growth, Utopia Sprawl, and various mana dorks to fuel Omnath's power. The strategy is to accelerate your mana production, play big threats like Primeval Titan and Emrakul, and overwhelm your opponent with strong creatures before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes a toolbox of creatures like Acidic Slime and Reclamation Sage to deal with any threats the opponent may have, as well as cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Birthing Pod to search for specific answers or win conditions. Overall, the key concept is to use fast mana ramp and powerful creatures to apply pressure and win the game quickly.

The main idea of this deck is to use the graveyard as a resource to continually generate value and control the board while setting up for a powerful combo finish. Meren of Clan Nel Toth's ability to return creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield provides a strong engine for recurring impactful creatures and disrupting opponents' strategies. The deck includes a variety of efficient mana dorks and creatures with strong enter-the-battlefield effects to ramp up and control the board. With cards like Birthing Pod and Survival of the Fittest, the deck can tutor for key pieces and assemble combo finishes like Craterhoof Behemoth or Viscera Seer + Phyrexian Altar. The overall strategy is to outvalue opponents over the long game and win with a powerful combo.

The primary focus of this deck is to utilize the graveyard to fuel powerful combos and control the board. Meren of Clan Nel Toth serves as the commander, allowing for the recursion of creatures from the graveyard. The deck includes various creatures with enter the battlefield and sacrifice abilities to generate value and disrupt opponents. Key cards such as Birthing Pod, Skullclamp, and Survival of the Fittest provide card advantage and tutor options. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Toxic Deluge to deal with threats. The mana base is optimized for consistent ramp and color fixing. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents through graveyard interactions and efficient creature plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that can quickly ramp up mana production while also providing creature tutors and card draw. With Animar, Soul of Elements as the commander, the goal is to cast creature spells that will reduce the cost of future creature spells and eventually combo off with cards like Cloudstone Curio, Birthing Pod, and Glimpse of Nature to create a chain of powerful creature plays. The deck's strategy revolves around efficiently casting creatures with various abilities and using the commander's cost reduction ability to its fullest potential. By assembling the right combination of creatures and utilizing the mana base effectively, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a powerful board presence and win the game through a big combo turn.

This deck revolves around utilizing Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies. It includes a variety of counter spells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures to protect Geist and maintain control of the game. The deck also includes powerful card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dig Through Time to help pull ahead in the late game. Additionally, the deck incorporates powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance Geist's abilities and close out games quickly. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana and to support the control strategy effectively.

The deck revolves around quickly assembling a combination of cards to generate a powerful board state that overwhelms the opponent. Prossh, Skyraider of Kher is utilized as the commander to create an army of tokens and provide a win condition. The deck includes multiple efficient removal spells and disruption to control the game and protect the combo pieces. Key cards such as Birthing Pod, Survival of the Fittest, and Shared Animosity help find and enable the combo pieces. Additionally, the deck includes powerful ramp cards like Elves of Deep Shadow and Solemn Simulacrum to accelerate the game plan. Overall, the strategy aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a large army of creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage to out-value the opponent. The deck runs a variety of powerful control cards such as Cryptic Command, Force of Will, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the battlefield. Tasigur, the Golden Fang serves as a powerful recursion engine, allowing the player to consistently re-use powerful spells from their graveyard. The mana base is carefully crafted to support a variety of colors and provide access to powerful utility lands such as Maze of Ith and Bojuka Bog. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a win through superior card advantage and strategic play.
